poem:
**Erased Colors**

Rainbow brushed blank  
by night's insistence—  
where stories crossed,  
a silent street  
now speaks of absence.  
  
Pulse echoes, muted,  
beneath tire threads  
while hollow asphalt  
hides bright histories,  
unseen—  
  
the colors once  
bright, a memory  
of voices  
beneath the stars,  
calling.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Florida removes rainbow crosswalk honoring victims of Pulse nightclub shooting A rainbow crosswalk designed to honor victims of a mass shooting at a LGBTQ+ nightclub in Orlando was painted over by the Florida state government on Wednesday night. The abrupt erasure of the memorial street crossing, which honored the 49 people killed at the Pulse nightclub in 2016, was described as a “scandalous act of betrayal” by one Florida state senator. Florida has seen numerous". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
